ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.menu

Class TestsMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.tools.SubMenu
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.menu.TestsMenu

  • public class TestsMenu
extends SubMenu
    This is the Tests Menu, named "Tests Menu" from the Main Menu options. By default, this class contains an example item, and space is left to the next programmers to fill in the further menu options that they wish to use.

    This menu is intended to store menu options for controlling the robot for any sort of test that integrates or operates the other aspects of the robot.

    This menu is originally provided as an extra sub menu to store routines that are specifically for testing, however this menu is does not need to be used, and it does not need to be used for this purpose. Instead, every routine can be stored in the DemosMenu.

    Author:
    Ryan Au
    See Also:
    DemosMenu

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TestsMenu getInstance()
        Creates and returns an instance of SubMenu that contains menu items specific to the TestsMenu in the form of MenuAction instances or MenuCommand instances. Each of these actions are essentially run in the main thread, but the user running the program gets to pick which commands to run at the times they wish via the menu displayed on the LCD of the EV3.

        see @see ca.mcgill.ecse211.tools.MenuAction and see @see ca.mcgill.ecse211.tools.MenuCommand for more information on actions.

        Returns:
        Returns the same instance of TestsMenu every time.

      • test1

        public boolean test1()
        An example test method that can be run by a menu option.
        Returns:
        true to exit the current menu, false to stay in it.
